bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Juan Guiteras, January 5, 1923

div1.p: Rose regrets that Guiteras will resign from the International Health Board's Yellow Fever Council. He thanks Guiteras for his contributions to the yellow fever work.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Juan Guiteras, January 5, 1923
div1.p:
Your letter of December 28 has been received, just as
I am getting off to London. We regret exceedingly that you feel
it necessary to resign from membership on the Yellow Fever Council.
The matter will be brought to the attention of the Executive Com-
mittee at its next meeting. It will cause us keen regret to
accept your resignation, but at the same time I am sure that the
Committee will understand that you might feel it too heavy a
burden to be called upon for advice as a member of the Council.

With warm personal regards, and with appreciation of
your contribution toward the task of eliminating yellow fever
from the Western Hemisphere, I am
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, WICKLIFFE ROSE Doctor Juan Guiteras
Benavides
Cuba
